thread.title: Pair cut free after serious crash
thread.title_full: Pair cut free after serious crash

title: Pair cut free after serious crash
text:
Pair cut free after serious crash near Burley Pair cut free after serious crash 5 comments 
TWO women needed to be cut from their car after a smash on a main road in the early hours of today. 
The two casualties were in a vehicle travelling along the A35 in Burley when it left the road shortly before 12.30am. 
A crew of 12 firefighters from Burley and New Milton fire stations arrived to free them. Share article 
A spokesman for So uth Central Ambulance Service said paramedics treated both women for minor injuries at the scene but they did not need hospital treatment. 
It is not known how the crash occurred. Promoted Stories Pair cut free after serious crash near Burley   forest-dweller 8:45am Wed 14 Oct 15 
Don't want to be pedantic, but the A35 isn't exactly in Burley. I know it says that the reason for the crash isn't known but I presume that this is the usual crash spot where people come over the old railway bridge (where the Old Station Tea Rooms are) too fast and lose it. The other one seems to be coming down the hill from the other direction and clipping the raised curb on the slight corner on the down hill bit. Either way, I cannot understand how people can crash on a perfectly normal bit of road, save for taking it far too fast.
